intro: Alchornea janeirensis, commonly known as the Brazilian rubber tree, is a species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers and has a milky sap that is similar to latex. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique properties, it has been studied for potential uses in traditional medicine and industrial applications.
